StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: PGRN: Pharmacogenomics of Anti-Platelet Interventions (The PAPI Study)

Person.Organization: UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND BALTIMOREBALTIMORE VA MEDICAL CENTER

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: Funding support for the Pharmacogenomics Anti-Platelet Intervention (PAPI) Study was provided through the NIH, NIGMS (U01 GM074518). PAPI is one of the genome-wide association data studies funded as part of the Pharmacogenomics Research Network (PGRN). Phenotyping, genotyping, data cleaning, and GWAS analysis was performed by Dr. Alan Shuldiner and co-investigators and staff at the Amish Research Clinic in Lancaster, PA and the University of Maryland School of Medicine in Baltimore, MD.
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: General research use. The Amish are a defined population with large and unique pedigree structures that are publicly available. Therefore, to minimize risk of breech of confidentiality, no individual-level data will be supplied to dbGaP. Only summary data (phenotypes, allele frequencies, results of GWAS association analyses) will be provided. Individual level data can be requested from the PI on a case by case basis The informed consent document signed by the PAPI Study Participants allows use of these data by co-investigators in the Pharmacogenomics Research Network and other scientists with interest in CVD or related areas. This consent group does not require IRB approval.

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use
ConsentGroup.name: GRU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: The informed consent document signed by the PAPI Study Participants allows use of these data by co-investigators in the Pharmacogenomics Research Network and other scientists with interest in CVD or related areas. This consent group does not require IRB approval.

StudyTo.name: NHLBI Big Data Analysis Heart Failure Challenge Data Collection
